items.title: Man who killed two people in Bowen Bridge crash sentenced to home detention and community service
items.summary: A man who caused the death of an elderly couple while driving with methamphetamine in his blood is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service and four months of home detention.

items.title: Man charged over newborn's death in Gold Coast M1 crash granted bail
items.summary: A man charged over a crash that killed a one-month-old baby on the Gold Coast has been granted bail following an 11-week police investigation.

items.title: National cabinet agrees unanimously to strengthen Australia's strict gun laws in wake of Bondi terror attack
items.summary: An urgent meeting of national cabinet agrees to strengthen Australia's gun laws in the wake of the Bondi Beach shooting.

items.title: Man convicted of kidnapping 19yo Charlie Gander now eligible for parole
items.summary: A judge says the offending of a man found guilty of kidnapping a Victorian 19-year-old, who was later murdered, was "spontaneous" and "born of panic".

items.title: Deaths of Rob Reiner and wife investigated as apparent homicide, LAPD says
items.summary: Rob Reiner, known for directing When Harry Met Sally... and A Few Good Men, was found dead alongside his wife inside their Los Angeles home.

items.title: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai found guilty of sedition and collusion
items.summary: Jimmy Lai, a former Hong Kong media mogul and one of the city's most outspoken critics of China, has been found guilty of sedition and collusion in a landmark national security case that has drawn international scrutiny.

items.title: Inquest to probe death of Allan John Houston at Saraji mine in 2018
items.summary: The veteran miner died when the bulldozer he was operating rolled off an embankment into a pool of mud.

items.title: What videos tell us about the final moments of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack
items.summary: In the final horrific minutes of the Bondi Beach terror attack, more than 100 shots were fired. ABC NEWS Verify has analysed footage showing how the last six minutes unfolded.

items.title: Cameron Pearson admits murdering Perth lawyer Alice McShera at Crown Towers
items.summary: A 44-year-old man admits killing Perth lawyer Alice McShera, whose body was found in a hotel room in the upmarket Crown Towers complex in 2023.

items.title: Anthony Albanese will face questions over Bondi Beach shooting as Australia mourns
items.summary: Anthony Albanese's first responsibility after the horrific Bondi terror attack is to lead a grieving nation. His next will be to explain how this happened.

items.title: Parole release of Snowtown murderer James Vlassakis overturned
items.summary: Snowtown serial killer James Vlassakis will remain behind bars, after the South Australian Parole Board's decision to release him was overturned.

items.title: Queensland Police ramp up presence at Jewish places of worship after Bondi mass shooting, as public Hanukkah events cancelled
items.summary: Queensland Police Acting Commissioner Cheryl Scanlon says authorities are not aware of any specific threats to the state.

items.title: Soren Copley in court over Philippines child sex abuse allegations
items.summary: The Australian Federal Police says it launched an investigation into North Queensland man Soren Copley in September after a tip-off from US Homeland Security.

items.title: Kahu's been woodchopping his whole life, but a heart attack mid-competition almost killed him
items.summary: Kahu Woolley was clinically dead multiple times, but quick actions by his friends brought him back.

items.title: Matildas star Sam Kerr impresses again for Chelsea in WSL after starting as sub
items.summary: Matildas gun Sam Kerr starts on the bench again, but makes an immediate impact for Chelsea in a 3-0 WSL victory.

items.title: WA's wettest towns have had no local drinking water for 15 years
items.summary: Quinninup and Northcliffe in Western Australia's south-west receive an average of 1 metre of rain every year, so why has the state government spent millions of dollars trucking in drinking water?

items.title: Sussan Ley accuses Albanese of failing to keep Jewish Australians safe
items.summary: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley says Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has allowed antisemitism to "fester" and failed to keep Jewish Australians safe in the wake of yesterday's "evil" terror attack on the shores of Bondi.

items.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong, Death Stranding 2 and Donkey Kong Bananza among our best games of 2025
items.summary: There are games to suit everyone, and overwhelmingly Australians are a game-playing nation. Here are some of the most important titles released this year.

items.title: England warned Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks ahead of third Ashes Test
items.summary: With England pinning its hopes on victory in the third Test, the tourists have been warned that the Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks.

items.title: Kendrick Lamar delights young fan with birthday song at Canberra Spilt Milk festival
items.summary: American rap superstar Kendrick Lamar brought the house down at Spilt Milk in Canberra, but it was his interaction with a nine-year-old superfan that stole the show.

items.title: Celine Cremer search party given hope by mobile phone find, as they wait for improved weather conditions
items.summary: One of the key searchers involved in the renewed hunt for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer has told of the emotion and excitement when her mobile phone was found, two and a half years after she disappeared in Tasmania.

items.title: ASIO examined Bondi Beach gunman Naveed Akram in 2019 for close ties to Islamic State cell
items.summary: Australia's domestic intelligence agency, ASIO, examined one of the Bondi Beach gunmen six years ago for his close ties to a Sydney-based Islamic State terrorism cell, the ABC understands.

items.title: Cooper Connolly stars as Perth Scorchers down Sydney Sixers in BBL opener
items.summary: Cooper Connolly leads the Scorchers to victory as star Sixers recruit Babar Azam struggles in the BBL curtain raiser at Perth Stadium.

items.title: Australian share market falls, ASX Limited shares tumble on ASIC hit — as it happened
items.summary: Shares in stock exchange operator ASX fell as the regulator increases its capital requirements after damning inquiry findings. The local share market started the week in the red, weighed down by heavy selling in the miners.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting updates: PM to strengthen gun laws across Australia following Bondi attack — as it happened
items.summary: Fifteen people were killed, including a 10-year-old girl. One of the two gunmen has also died, while a further 42 people were taken to hospital.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting death toll rises as police scour crime scene after terrorist attack
items.summary: Fifteen people and one of two gunmen are confirmed to have died after the attack on Sunday evening as members of the Jewish community attended a Hanukkah event in the city's eastern suburbs.

items.title: Superannuation funds accused of delaying disability insurance claims
items.summary: The regulator has found that while some superannuation funds have improved insurance claims response times, others are still falling short, with long delays in relation to mental health claims.

items.title: Retiring captain Elyse Villani says Hurricanes' WBBL win shows team's potential
items.summary: Elyse Villani has described the Hurricanes' win as a "fairy tale" ending to her WBBL career.

items.title: Antarctic Arts Fellowship allows artists to develop works on the ice
items.summary: Over the past four decades, the Australian Antarctic Arts Fellowship has given creatives the opportunity to travel south and develop works on the icy continent.

items.title: Photographing penguins in Antarctica
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Brain research centre The Florey sues executive, alleging he stole and erased files
items.summary: Australia's biggest brain research centre is suing one of its executives, alleging he deleted troves of commercially sensitive information during a midnight incursion at its Melbourne laboratory.

items.title: Australia's medicinal cannabis situation leaves government in a bind
items.summary: There doesn't seem to be much political mileage for the government to do anything at all — whether that is cracking down and forcing cannabis users back onto the black market or fully legalising the substance.

items.title: More Bondi Beach shooting victims named, including 10yo girl and rabbis
items.summary: A 10-year-old girl named Matilda has been identified as one of the victims of Sunday's terror attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach.

items.title: Anthony Albanese condemns Bondi Beach terror attack as 'act of evil antisemitism'
items.summary: Anthony Albanese condemns the Bondi beach terror attack as an "act of evil antisemitism" targeting Australia's Jewish community, declaring the nation will never submit to "division, violence or hatred".

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting witnesses recall running for their lives as attack unfolded
items.summary: Witnesses at Bondi Beach as gunshots rang out just after 6:30pm on Sunday have described the panic that swept the crowd.

items.title: Law enforcement source identifies Bondi gunman as Sydney man Naveed Akram
items.summary: A law enforcement official has told the ABC that police have raided one of the alleged gunman's house in Sydney's south-west.

items.title: What we know so far about the Bondi Beach shooting
items.summary: Sixteen people are dead after two gunmen fired dozens of shots into crowds of people at Bondi Beach. Here's what we know so far.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting updates: Terrorist attack on Jewish community event — as it happened
items.summary: Twelve people are confirmed dead and dozens are injured in a terrorist attack on the Chanukah by the Sea celebration at Sydney's Bondi Beach. Look back at our coverage from the day.

items.title: At least 12 people dead as Bondi Beach attack declared act of terrorism
items.summary: At least 12 people, including one shooter, have been killed in an attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach on Sunday evening, NSW Police have confirmed.

items.title: Short-form videos could be harming young minds
items.summary: Online short-form video has shifted from a light distraction to a constant backdrop in many children's lives. But they were never built with children in mind, although many children use them daily.

items.title: Brendon McCullum vows against 'knee-jerk reactions' for third Ashes Test in Adelaide
items.summary: England coach Brendon McCullum confirms his side's batting line-up will be unchanged for its must-win third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Researchers call for water safety to be part of English education for migrants
items.summary: As the country heads into the summer holidays, experts are again warning Australians to be aware of swim safety at beaches, pools and other waterways.

items.title: WA government to roll out six more high-tech cameras to capture driver bad behaviour
items.summary: The road safety cameras will be installed across the state and include six new high-tech devices to capture driver bad behaviour.

items.title: Australians open to dealing with AI on a Triple Zero emergency call, study finds
items.summary: Could artificial intelligence speed up emergency responses by receiving a caller's video or smartwatch data and capturing words like "knife" and "collision"? Most people think so and welcome the technology's potential, a survey finds.

items.title: 'It's cooked': Big Brother contestant quit so she could afford the dentist
items.summary: Data obtained by the ABC shows people are waiting months, if not years, for dental care in every Australian state and territory due to the cost.

items.title: Police condemn 'outrageous' Guildford West shooting as vision shows 30 bullets fired into home
items.summary: The vision shows the moment a gunman sprayed an underworld associate's home with up to 30 rounds while two women and a child were inside.

items.title: Tasmania Police to formally join renewed search for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer
items.summary: Tasmania Police says it will formally join the independent search for missing Belgian woman Celine Cremer, after her mobile phone was found by a private search party on Saturday.

items.title: I’m heading overseas. Do I really need travel vaccines?
items.summary: Australia is in its busiest month for short-term overseas travel. And there are so many things to consider when planning your trip. Unfortunately, it's easy to overlook the importance of pre-travel vaccinations.

items.title: Virtual fencing is now legal in NSW. This is what you need to know
items.summary: NSW farmers have been given the green light to use virtual fencing, providing an option over traditional posts and wires. Here is how it works.

items.title: Books reflecting remote Indigenous lifestyles and culture 'key' to students' reading success
items.summary: An educator says books that reflect remote Indigenous cultures and lifestyles are "the key to success" in improving reading outcomes for First Nations students.

items.title: Brett Lee backs current Australian bowling attack as greatest ever
items.summary: Brett Lee ranks Australia's bowling attack as better than the one he was part of, which featured the likes of Glenn McGrath and Shane Warne.

items.title: Households without power after Russian attack on Ukraine's power grid
items.summary: Five people were left wounded from the attack that Volodymyr Zelenskyy said consisted of more than 450 drones and 30 missiles.

items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Orchid enthusiasts call for greater protection for native species facing habitat threats
items.summary: Two centuries after orchids were first documented in South Australia, photographers are still discovering new plants.

items.title: Budding musicians on NSW far south coast create songs about First Nations culture
items.summary: With sounds recorded in a makeshift studio, this group of high school students produced music about First Nations culture.

items.title: Two students killed, nine injured in shooting at Brown University — as it happened
items.summary: Two students have been killed and nine other people have been injured after a gunman entered an engineering building during final exams at Brown University in the US.

items.title: Conservationist uses invasive fox fur to make ethical clothing
items.summary: In six months, Emma Sinclair went from not knowing how to sew to launching her own fashion label based around fox fur.

items.title: Pulp Fiction, The Mask actor Peter Greene dies aged 60
items.summary: Peter Greene, a character actor best known for his role as the iconic villain, Zed in Pulp Fiction, has died.

items.title: Two-thirds of women escaping violence in Broome cannot access help
items.summary: In a region with Western Australia's highest rates of family and domestic violence, a Kimberley service provider says it can only help one-third of women who need it.

items.title: Alpha Bakery making famous pies again with family support after dementia diagnosis
items.summary: Christopher Tilse has worked from dawn to dusk in a bakery most of his life. Dementia made that a challenge, but thanks to family support, he is still baking.

items.title: Medical groups push for consequences for freebirth 'birthkeepers' posing as medical professionals
items.summary: A number of recent deaths linked to freebirths — where a pregnant woman chooses to give birth with no registered medical professional present — is prompting health groups to speak out about rising levels of misinformation.

items.title: Lionel Messi's India tour begins in chaos, seats ripped out in Kolkata
items.summary: Indian football fans ripped up seats and invaded the pitch in Kolkata as Lionel Messi's first appearance in India took a chaotic and dangerous turn.
